excerpt: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 0.0.6Published on 2024-07-01Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Desktop This SDK provides additional services / t
content: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 0.0.6Published on 2024-07-01Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Desktop This SDK provides additional services / tools for these platforms: Windows, MacOs, and Linux. Only x64 platform is supported. It uses as dependencies Rainbow.CSharp.SDK, Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.Medias and Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions libraries. Te be more precise this library is a specific implementation of Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions which target Desktop platforms (as opposed to mobile platforms like Android or iOS). Nuget package The SDK is provided as a Nuget package available here This package targets .Net Standard 2.0, .Net Standard 2.1, .Net Core App 3.1 and .Net 6.0 WebRTC features Since this library is a implementation of Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions, it provides same features than the ones described in Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC library. So please refer to the documentation of this library Third-Party Libraries This implementation is using Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.Medias library. So please refer also to the documentation of this library to know how to use it to manage medias and alos to know which third party libraires must be installed. title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 1.XPublished on 2024-07-01Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC ! This SDK provides additional services / features
content: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 1.XPublished on 2024-07-01Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC ! This SDK provides additional services / features to the Rainbow CSharp SDK (core) library. So you need first to understand how to use it. Nuget package The SDK is provided as a Nuget package available here This package targets .Net Standard 2.0, .Net Standard 2.1, .Net Core 6.0 and .Net 8.0 WebRTC features Permits to manage WebRTC communications: Peer To Peer or in a Conference using Rainbow environment (https://developers.openrainbow.com/home) Peer To Peer communication features: Answer, Decline, Make, Retract, Hang up call Add / Remove Video or Sharing Mute / Unmute Audio, Video or Sharing Call status: Ringing incoming, ringing outgoing, in progress, ... Audio Stream: Output and Input are supported Video Stream: Output is supported. Input is not supported (work still in progress) Conference features: Start, Join Conference Participants list Publishers list Mute / Unmute: current user but also other Peers if current user is a moderator of the conference Call status: Ringing incoming, ringing outgoing, in progress, ... Display Active Talker. Current user of this SDK is never seen as Active Talker (work still in progress) Add / Remove Video or Sharing Subscribe (automatically or manualy) to publication of Peers (Video or Sharing) Request / Refuse / Accept Sharing transfert Conference delegation Audio Stream: Output and Input are supported Video Stream: Ouput is supported. Input is not supported (work still in progress) Abstractions and Implementations This package use abstractions to offer those WebRTC features based on specific implementations. For the moment, two implementations are available: Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Desktop Third library used: SIPSorcery, FFmpeg libraries and SDL2 Comptatible Windows, MacOs and Linux platforms Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Unity Available only in private access for the moment Third library used: Unity and WebRTC for Unity Comptatible with Windows, MacOs and Linux, Android, iOS platforms Developping with the Rainbow.WebRTC SDK Quick overview on how to use the Rainbow.WebRTC sdk to develop a webrtc enabled application. It is intended to be about general principles and is not specific to the implementation. For specific, check documentation of he implementation you want to use. Instantiation Create a Rainbow.Application object Rainbow Application myApp = new Rainbow.Application(); Configure application credentials and platform Enable restrictions on Conferences Monitor ConnectionStateChanged and InitializationPerformed Call Login() The SDK will try to connect to the platform using the supplied (application and user) credentials. If it failed you are informed in the optional callback. When it's done initializing and retrieving informations it will raise the InitializationPerformed signal. At this stage the SDK can be used. If your application makes use of bubbles or conferences, when InitializationPerformed is received it should call Bubbles.GetAllBubbles(). It is the right time to instantiate a WebRTCCommunications object, which will make it possible make calls or join conference. You can find more informations about the Rainbow SDK Here. This quick diagram summarizes how to initialize an application who would use WebRTCCommunications. Events in WebRTCCommunications The most importants events to handle to issue webrtc calls in your applications are CallUpdated , MediaPublicationUpdated and OnTrack. When a user receives a call, or is issuing the call, the WebRTCCommunications class informs him of the progression of the call using the CallUpdated events. The event provides you with an instance of the Call class, containing many useful information like The status The local and remote medias established on the call The participants The call Id which is needed to perform actions on this calls, like decline the call, hangup, publish some medias.. The other important event to handle is MediaPublicationUpdated. This happens each time a local or remote media is added to the call. A MediaPublicationUpdated event provides a MediaPublication object which can be used to subscribe to a MediaPublication using the method WebRTCCommunications.SubscribeToMediaPublication. Calling this method means that your application is interested in this media. If you subscribe to a media publication WebRTCommunications will send you the associated MediaStreamTrack using OnTrack event. Making Calls and Receiving Calls Here is a simplified (and incomplete) diagram showing how to use WebRTCCommunications events and methods to establish an audio Peer to peer call, using the MakeCall method. When another user calls your application, WebRTCCommunications emits a CallUpdated with a CallStatus of RINGING_INCOMING . To accept the call use WebRTCCommunications.AnswerCall, and to decline use WebRTCCommunications.RejectCall. What happens after AnswerCall is similar to wh

excerpt: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 1.XPublished on 2024-07-01CompareSDK.WebRTC for C# [1.0.0] - 2024-07-01 Changed .Net 6.0 as target plateform has been removed (obsolete). .Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 8
content: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 1.XPublished on 2024-07-01CompareSDK.WebRTC for C# [1.0.0] - 2024-07-01 Changed .Net 6.0 as target plateform has been removed (obsolete). .Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 8.0 are still in targets platform. [0.0.15-STS] - 2024-05-27 Changed Breaking WebRTCCommunications: Add parameter subStreamLevel in `SubscribeToMediaPublication()' [0.0.14-STS] - 2024-03-19 Added DataChannel: new class - before a IDataChannel interface was used DataChannel.Close(): permits to unsubscribe to remote DataChannel or To remove DataChannel of the current user DataChannelDescriptor: new class MediaStreamTrackDescriptor: IsMediaService property WebRTCCommunications: CanSubscribeToMediaService(), IsSubscribedToMediaService(), SubscribeToMediaService(), UnsubscribeToMediaService(), GetMediaServicesSubscribed() and GetMediaServicesAvailable() methods WebRTCCommunications: HoldMediaPublication(), HoldMediaService(), GetTracks() and GetDataChannels() methods WebRTCCommunications: OnMediaServiceUpdated event Fixed WebRTCCommunications: avoid crash in GetOrCreateInstance() when simultaneous bots are used WebRTCCommunications: Update medias currenlty used (local or remote) before OnMediaPublicationUpdated event is raised Changed Breaking DataChannelInCallDelegate: Signature changed to use a DataChannelDescriptor [0.0.13-STS] - 2024-01-15 Added Add .Net 8.0 as target plateform (.Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still in targets platform) .Net 6.0 target platform will be removed in April. (Alpha support) Allow to manage DataChannel in a Conference . Only one DataChannel can be created for the moment by user but several can be subscribed. Fixed PeerConnection are closed/disposed in a better way in P2P and Conference, media status are set correctly: SendRecv, SendOnly, RecvOnly, Inactive [0.0.12-STS] - 2023-12-08 Fixed WebRTCCommunications: Event CallUpdated could be not raised if a media was added or removed in conference by a remote peer [0.0.11-STS] - 2023-09-05 Changed Use last version of SDK.Medias to use FFmpeg v6.0 libraries WebRTCCommunications: Allow to set ConfigurationOptions object in MakeCall(), AnswerCall(), StartAndJoinConference(), JoinConference(), AddVideo(), AddSharing(), AddDataChannel() [0.0.10] - STS - 2023-07-07 Enhancements Allow to suscribe to dynamic feed (i.e. to see in one stream the active talker if he's using its web cam): DynamicFeed property (new) in MediaPublication object must be set to true when SubscribeToMediaPublication is used to subscribe to video media publication. Once subscription is done, event OnTrack is raised. Then the DynamicFeed property (new) of MediaStreamTrackDescriptor object permits to know that this track contains the dynamic feed. Framework targets .Net Core App 3.1 is no more targetted (already deprecated by Microsoft). .Net Standardd 2.0 / 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still targetted [0.0.9] - STS - 2023-05-26 Fix: Test to check if Video subscription must be done was incorrect In Conference, when sharing is added, a session-initiate is received. We have to send session-terminate if we don't subscribe to it. In Conference: Subscribe/Unsubscribe on Media before/after the join is now well managed. In P2P, Video and Sharing stream from remote are handled faster Correclty handle stream status to create a valid SDP Enhancements: Architecture has been reworked to build a common library compatible with a Desktop WebRTC implementation and Unity WebRTC implementation. The Desktop WebRTC implementation is equivalent in term of features, dependencies and target platform as the previous version of this library: - Based on SipSorcery, FFmpeg and SDL2 - Target Windows, MacOS and Linux The Unity WebRTC implementation permits to use Rainbow SDK C# with WebRTC features in a Unity project - Unity use the WebRTC implementation provided by the Chromium project. - Unity targets Android, iOS but also Windows, Mac, Linux, Extended Reality devices (XR), Consoles (PS5, XBox, Switch), WebGL It was necessary to create a new package called Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions which provide objects and interfaces to inherit / use to be compatible with this new package architecture. To provide Desktop WebRTC implementation, a new Nuget package, Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Desktop, implements interfaces and use objects defined in Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions. To provide Unity WebRTC implementation, a new Unity package, Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Unity, implements interfaces and use objects defined in Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions. This package is not yet available publicly but it has been tested with success on Android and some XR devices There is no more media or device management in this package. It's done in each implementation since it's specific for each. [0.0.8] - STS - 2023-02-10 Thanks to new version of the SDK C# Medias, it's now possible to decode incoming media (Audio, Video and Sharing ) from P2P call or Conference call. Connecting state is now correctly managed to a

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: Rainbow SDK for WebThe perfect choice for your web site or web applicationReady to get started with Rainbow SDK for Web?Everything you need to get started with Rainbow SDK for WebFirst steps with Web
content: Rainbow SDK for WebThe perfect choice for your web site or web applicationReady to get started with Rainbow SDK for Web?Everything you need to get started with Rainbow SDK for WebFirst steps with Web SDKDownload Web SDKCheck Web Starter-KitsUseful informationVersion: LTS 4.0.0Published: 21 déc. 2022Last Updated: 21 nov. 2022Consult the changelogToggle to STS documentationEasily integrated into your websiteThe Rainbow SDK for Web is easily integrated into any web site or web application just by adding a few lines of code. Once done, your web site or application will be connected to Rainbow and able to use every available Rainbow service.Any browserAny device or OSAny JS FrameworkOffers a friendly debug consoleA fully documented Web SDKThe Rainbow SDK for Web provides you the best API for connecting to Rainbow and integrating with your site. These API have been carefully developed and are well-documented with the necessary details to help you to build your application.Complete collaborative featuresThe Rainbow SDK for Web provides the services you need to build a complete social network. Make your site a relationship machine. Chat or share files with a single recipient or to a group. Have an audio call with someone, enhance it by adding video. Rainbow makes it possible!SDK for Web at a glance.Learn about the main APIs provided by this SDKSimple JS libraryLoad the JavaScript Rainbow SDK from your web site or application and use it in some lines of code. It is compliant with the main JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular and JQuery.Contacts, search and presence APIHandle your contact list and know when they are available, busy on the phone or away. Search for users by name or id to extend your network.One-to-one Chat APIExchange messages with your contacts. Be alerted when contacts send you a message. You can retrieve the whole conversation or only the most recent messages.Bubbles groupchat APICreate and invite users, or reuse your bubbles for talking together. In a bubble, everyone can participate to the conversation.WebRTC audio and video APIYou can initiate audio and video calls to your contacts using your browser without a plug-in. Enhance your call from audio only to video. Choose which device you want to use and control the call (mute/unmute).WebRTC Conference APIYou can join a conference in a bubble. Control the video you want to see and control your device (mute/unmute).Files sharing APIShare files with a user in a one-to-one chat or within a bubble with several participants. You're also able to download files shared by others in your bubble.Groups APIGroup your contacts by activity, other... . Make some groups become your favorites groups.PSTN telephony APIYou can initiate or anwer any call with your PBX phone. The API covers all basic telephony features such as putting a call on hold and retrieving it, diverting a call to voice mail, making a conference call with multiple participants and more.Channels APISend messages to channels which may have more than thousands suscribers. Subscribe to users public channels to follow them and receive what they publish!Interesting linksLearn how to use our SDKsNeed some help?Contact our support teamVisit our homepageFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

excerpt: DocumentationBubbles serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Bubbles This service manages multi-party communications in Rainbow (aka bubbles). Bubbles allow to chat and to share files with sev
content: DocumentationBubbles serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Bubbles This service manages multi-party communications in Rainbow (aka bubbles). Bubbles allow to chat and to share files with several participants. Each user can create bubbles and invite other Rainbow users to be part of it. Without being invited, users can join a bubble. The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Create new bubbles, - Invite and manage participants in your bubbles - Accept or decline invites received from bubbles - Leave, close or remove your bubbles Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONBUBBLEINVITATIONTOJOINRECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONBUBBLEUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONBUBBLEAVATARUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONBUBBLEDEACTIVATED Access: public A call is a "short" interaction between the user and one or several contacts (Rainbow users or not) that uses either a WebRTC media (audio, video or screen sharing) or a Telephony media (PBX phone). No Rainbow users such as external users can only be engaged into a Telephony call. A call is always attached to a conversation. call.globalCallId Kind: instance property of Call Access: public Read only: true Properties NameTypeDescription globalCallIdstringa global id when the call content: DocumentationCallsLog serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 CallsLog This service allow to get the call log and manage it. The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Get all calls log - Delete one or all calls log - Mark calls as read / unread Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGACKUPDATED Access: public CallsLog fetchCallLogs(numberOfCallLogs) ⇒ Promise fetchPaginatedCallLogs(numberOfElementsPerPage) ⇒ Promise getMissedCallLogCounter() ⇒ number getMissedCallLogNumber() ⇒ number deleteOneCallLog(id) ⇒ boolean deleteCallLogsForContact(jid) ⇒ boolean deleteAllCallLogs() ⇒ void markCallLogAsRead(id) ⇒ void markAllCallsLogsAsRead() ⇒ void isInitialized() ⇒ boolean callsLog.fetchCallLogs(numberOfCallLogs) ⇒ Promise Get the Call-logs for current user; If this is the first time, the API will load the latest 'numberOfCallLogs' entries for this user Otherwise it will give all the available already loaded call-logs for this user; The user is able to ask for more call-logs via fetchPaginatedCallLogs API; Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: Promise - Promise with an array of call log entry Access: public ParamTypeDescription numberOfCallLogsnumberSpecify number of call logs to fetch from the server. Defaults to 100. (max value allowed 250) callsLog.fetchPaginatedCallLogs(numberOfElementsPerPage) ⇒ Promise Get all available call-logs already loaded + the new fetched from the server Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: Promise - Promise with an array of call log entry Access: public ParamTypeDescription numberOfElementsPerPagenumberSpecify number of call logs to fetch from the server. Defaults to 100. (max value allowed 250) callsLog.getMissedCallLogCounter() ⇒ number Get the number of call missed (state === "missed" && direction === "incoming") Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: number - The number of call missed Access: public callsLog.getMissedCallLogNumber() ⇒ number Get the number of call missed (state === "missed" && direction === "incoming") You can call this method before retrieving all the callLogs from the server (by using fetch) Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: number - The number of call missed Access: public callsLog.deleteOneCallLog(id) ⇒ boolean Delete a call log from it's id You have to listen to event RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGUPDATED to know when the action is finished Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: boolean - true Access: public ParamTypeDescription idstringThe call log id to remove callsLog.deleteCallLogsForContact(jid) ⇒ boolean Delete all calls log items associated to a contact's given jid You have to listen to event RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGUPDATED to know when the action is finished Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: boolean - true Access: public ParamTypeDescription jidstringThe call log id to remove callsLog.deleteAllCallLogs() ⇒ void Delete all call logs history You have to listen to event RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGUPDATED to know when the action is finished Kind: instance method of CallsLog Access: public callsLog.markCallLogAsRead(id) ⇒ void Mark a call log item as read You have to listen to event RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGACKUPDATED to know when the action is finished Kind: instance method of CallsLog Access: public ParamTypeDescription idstringThe call log id callsLog.markAllCallsLogsAsRead() ⇒ void Mark all call log items as read You have to listen to event RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGACKUPDATED to know when the action is finished Kind: instance method of CallsLog Access: public callsLog.isInitialized() ⇒ boolean Check if the call log history has been received from Rainbow A false answer means that the call logs have not yet been retrieved from the server. Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: boolean - True if the call logs have been retrieved. False elsewhere. content: DocumentationChannel modelLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Channel Channel model. Channel ~id : string ~name : string ~visibility : string ~topic : string ~creatorId : string ~companyId : string ~creationDate : Date ~usersCount : number ~avatar : string ~lastAvatarUpdateDate : Date ~userRole : string ~messages : Array ~subscribed : boolean ~delted : boolean ~invited : boolean ~category : string ~users : Array ~subscribersCount : number ~messagesCount : number Channel~id : string ID of the channel Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~name : string Channel name Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~visibility : string Channel visibility. There are three possible options: "private" (only the owner may publish messages, add or remove users), "company" (company users may join or leave, may be found by searching by the users in the same company) or "public" (may be found by all the users, only allowed users can create a public channel). Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~topic : string Channel topic Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~creatorId : string Creator ID Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~companyId : string ID of the company that the channel is attached to Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~creationDate : Date Channel's creation date Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~usersCount : number Channel users count Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~avatar : string Channel avatar Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~lastAvatarUpdateDate : Date Last avatar update date Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~userRole : string User role - can be one of the following values: 'none', 'owner', 'publisher' or 'member' Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~messages : Array Messages published to the channel Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~subscribed : boolean Boolean representing the current subscription state. Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~delted : boolean Boolean indicating whether the channel has been deleted Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~invited : boolean Boolean indicating whether the user has been invited to subscribe to the channel Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~category : string Channel category Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~users : Array Channel users Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~subscribersCount : number Channel subscribers count Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~messagesCount : number Channel messages count Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true On this pageChannelChannel~id : stringChannel~name : stringChannel~visibility : stringChannel~topic : stringChannel~creatorId : stringChannel~companyId : stringChannel~creationDate : DateChannel~usersCount : numberChannel~avatar : stringChannel~lastAvatarUpdateDate : DateChannel~userRole : stringChannel~messages : ArrayChannel~subscribed : booleanChannel~delted : booleanChannel~invited : booleanChannel~category : stringChannel~users : ArrayChannel~subscribersCount : numberChannel~messagesCount : numberWas this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

content: DocumentationChannels serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Channels This service gives access to channels in Rainbow. It is a Publish–subscribe pattern implementation Rainbow users can create channels. Currently, there is a configuration limit for max_items=100 and a source code limit for max_payload_size=60000 bytes The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Get all channels owned by an user - Find a channel, get a channel, if owned modify it - Subscribe/Unsubscribe to a channel (you are not automatically subscried to a channel you own) - Publish a message to a channel - Manage users in a channel you own Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELMESSAGERECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELDELETED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELRETRACTMESSAGERECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELAVATARUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELUSERSUBSCRIBED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELUSERUNSUBSCRIBED Channels fetchMyChannels() ⇒ Promise createPublicChannel(channelName, channelTopic, category) ⇒ Promise createClosedChannel(channelName, [channelTopic], [category]) ⇒ Promise deleteChannel(id) ⇒ Promise fetchChannelsByName([name]) ⇒ Promise fetchChannelsByTopic([topic]) ⇒ Promise fetchChannelsByCategory([category]) ⇒ Promise fetchChannel(id) ⇒ Promise createItem(channelId, message, [title], [itemType]) ⇒ Promise subscribeToChannelById(id) ⇒ Promise subscribeToChannel(channel) ⇒ Promise unsubscribeFromChannelById(id) ⇒ Promise unsubscribeFromChannel(channel) ⇒ Promise updateChannel(id, [channelTopic], [visibility], [maxItems], [maxPayloadSize], [channelName], [category]) ⇒ Promise updateChannelVisibility(id, visibility) ⇒ Promise updateChannelVisibilityToPublic(id) ⇒ Promise updateChannelVisibilityToClosed(id) ⇒ Promise updateChannelName(id, channelName) ⇒ Promise updateChannelTopic(id, channelTopic) ⇒ Promise updateChannelCategory(id, category) ⇒ Promise updateChannelAvatar(id, urlAvatar) ⇒ Promise deleteChannelAvatar(id) ⇒ Promise fetchUsers(id, [options]) ⇒ Promise deleteAllUsersFromChannel(id) ⇒ Promise updateChannelUsers(id, users, [userType]) ⇒ Promise addMembersToChannel(id, users) ⇒ Promise addPublishersToChannel(id, users) ⇒ Promise addOwnersToChannel(id, users) ⇒ Promise deleteUsersFromChannel(id, users) ⇒ Promise fetchItems(id, [maxMessages], [beforeDate], [afterDate]) ⇒ Promise deleteItem(id, itemId) ⇒ Promise title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationConfig serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Config This service allows more fine-grained control over the behavior of particular components of the Rainbow Web SDK. You can set
content: DocumentationConfig serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Config This service allows more fine-grained control over the behavior of particular components of the Rainbow Web SDK. You can set the log levels, video stream qualty and more. Config setSimulcast(value) ⇒ boolean setVideoQuality(value) ⇒ string setVerboseLog(value) ⇒ boolean useNewModels(value) ⇒ boolean setDisplayOrder(value) ⇒ string setCustomLogger(logger) ⇒ void setAutoAway(value) ⇒ void setAutoAwayDelay(value) ⇒ void getCurrentConfig() ⇒ object config.setSimulcast(value) ⇒ boolean Set Simulcast feature. When turned on, the broadcasting user sends few streams of varying quality during the conference and a WebRTC one-to-one call. It can increase the consumption of bandwidth for the connected user. Turn off to send one stream with fixed quality. When simulcast is turned off you can use setVideoQuality() API to chose the video quality. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: boolean - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuebooleanTrue to turn on, false to turn off config.setVideoQuality(value) ⇒ string Set the video quality of the broadcasted video stream. The Simulcast feature needs to be turned off for the quality settings to be taken into account. User can chose between three levels: "low" - corresponding to 180p, "middle" - 360p and "high" - 720p. The exact resolution of the video stream depends on user's camera model and firmware. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: string - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuestringValue representing the video quality. Can be one of the following values: "low", "middle" or "high" config.setVerboseLog(value) ⇒ boolean Allows to have verbose logs when using the SDK Kind: instance method of Config Returns: boolean - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuebooleanTrue to activate verbose log. False to deactivate it config.useNewModels(value) ⇒ boolean Starting v1.86.0, the new models of different data have been introduced (contact, conversation...). Set to false to use the previous version of the models. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: boolean - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuebooleanTrue to activate new models. False to deactivate it config.setDisplayOrder(value) ⇒ string Set display order information attached to the contacts. It be one of the two values: "FL" or "LF". Can also be set via config object used in load() method. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: string - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuestringDisplay order: "FL" (first name, last name) or "LF" (last name, first name) config.setCustomLogger(logger) ⇒ void Set custom logger. Allows the user to pass custom logging method. Custom logger should accept strings as parameter. Defaults to false. setVerboseLog config parameter should be set to true in order for the customLogger to be activated. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: void - Returns void Access: public ParamTypeDescription loggeranyAny logger solution accepting the following format: customLogger(sdkMessageString) config.setAutoAway(value) ⇒ void Change auto away settings. By default, Rainbow will set connected user's presence to 'away' after 180 seconds. This setting lets the user to disable that feature. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: void - Returns void Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuebooleanTrue to activate autoAway (default), false to allow presence changing only manually config.setAutoAwayDelay(value) ⇒ void Change auto away delay settings. By default, Rainbow will set connected user's presence to 'away' after 180 seconds. This setting lets the user to change the delay after which the presence will be changed to 'away'. If the autoAway feature is deactivated, setting any delay above 0 will reactivate it again. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: void - Returns void Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuenumberTime of delay in seconds (defaults to 180s). Set to 0 to deactivate the autoAway feature and set the delay value to 0. config.getCurrentConfig() ⇒ object Get current configuration file Kind: instance method of Config Returns: object - Current config settings Access: public On this pageConfigconfig.setSimulcast(value) ⇒ booleanconfig.setVideoQuality(value) ⇒ stringconfig.setVerboseLog(value) ⇒ booleanconfig.useNewModels(value) ⇒ booleanconfig.setDisplayOrder(value) ⇒ stringconfig.setCustomLogger(logger) ⇒ voidconfig.setAutoAway(value) ⇒ voidconfig.setAutoAwayDelay(value) ⇒ voidconfig.getCurrentConfig() ⇒ objectWas this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us

content: DocumentationConnection serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Connection This service connects the user to Rainbow and listen to the connection state change. The main methods or events proposed in that service allow to: - Sign-in to Rainbow, - Sign-out from Rainbow, - Listen to the connection state change with Rainbow to discover if the platform is accessible or not, - Listen to the SDK for Web loading state change for handling when the SDK can be used Please find the table of error return codes for Sign-in {result.code} below - 1, Ok - -1, Error - -2, Unauthorized - -4, Error on event socket - -8, Id error on event socket - -16, Bad request - -32, Unsupported - -64, Not found Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONCONNECTIONSTATECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONSTARTED, event:RAINBOW_ONSTOPPED, event:RAINBOW_ONUSERTOKENRENEW, event:RAINBOW_ONUSERTOKENRENEWFAILED, event:RAINBOW_ONUSERTOKENWILLEXPIRE, event:RAINBOW_ONAPPTOKENRENEW, event:RAINBOW_ONAPPTOKENRENEWFAILED Connection signin(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ Promise signinOnRainbowOfficial(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowBeta(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowCPaasPreProd(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowDev(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowSandboxChina(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowChina(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowHosted(strLogin, strPassword, strHost) ⇒ object signinSandBoxWithToken(strToken) ⇒ Promise signinOnRainbowOfficialWithToken(strToken) ⇒ Promise signinOnRainbowBetaWithToken(strToken) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowDevWithToken(strToken) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowHostedWithToken(strToken, strHost) ⇒ object signinWithToken(strToken) ⇒ object setRenewedToken(strToken) ⇒ void signinOnRainbowWithOICD(strToken) ⇒ object styleSignInWithRainbowButton(color, size) ⇒ boolean signout() ⇒ Promise updateUserPassword(oldPassword, newPassword) ⇒ Promise getState() ⇒ string getToken() ⇒ string refreshToken() ⇒ Promise connection.signin(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ Promise Allow to sign-in to Rainbow Sandbox environment from a Rainbow Sandbox user account that already exists The Rainbow Sandbox environment will be used to access the Rainbow Cloud Services Kind: instance method of Connection Returns: Promise - If the promise is resolved, the object containing the user account information or an object containing an error if the promise is rejected Access: public ParamTypeDescription strLoginstringRainbow Sandbox user login strPasswordstringRainbow Sandbox user password connection.signinOnRainbowOfficial(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object Allow to sign-in to Rainbow official environment from a Rainbow official user account that already exists The Rainbow official environment will be used to access the Rainbow Cloud Services This method returns a promise Kind: instance method of Connection Returns: object - result If the promise is resolved, the object containing the user account information or an object containing an error if the promise is rejected. See signin for {result} details Access: public ParamTypeDescription strLoginstringRainbow official user login strPasswordstringRainbow official user password connection.signinOnRainbowBeta(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object Allow to sign-in to Rainbow beta environment from a Rainbow beta user account that already exists The Rainbow beta environment will be used to access the Rainbow Cloud Services This method returns a promise Kind: instance method of Connection Returns: object - If the promise is resolved, the object containing the user account information or an object containing an error if the promise is rejected See signin for {result} details Access: public ParamTypeDescription strLoginstringRainbow beta user login strPasswordstringRainbow beta user password connection.signinOnRainbowCPaasPreProd(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object Allow to sign-in to Rainbow CPaaS pre production environment from a Rainbow beta user account that already exists The Rainbow beta environment will be used to access the Rainbow Cloud Services This method returns a promise Kind: instance method of Connection Returns: object - If the promise is resolved, the object containing the user account information or an object containing an error if the promise is rejected Access: public ParamTypeDescription strLoginstringRainbow beta user login strPasswordstringRainbow beta user password connection.signinOnRainbowDev(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object Allow to sign-in to Rainbow dev environment from a Rainbow dev user account that already exists The Rainbow dev environment will be used to access the Rainbow Cloud Services This method returns a promise Kind: instance method of Connection Returns: object - If the promise is resolved, the object containing the user account information or an object containing an error if the promise is rejected Access: public ParamTypeDescription strLoginstringRainbow dev user login strPasswordstringRainbow dev user password connection.signinOnRainbowSandboxChina(st

content: DocumentationContact modelLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Contact This class is used to represent a contact or the connected user. A contact is defined by a set of public information (name, firstname, avatar) and a set of private information that are only shared with contacts that are in the user's network or in the same company (email, phone numbers) Contact ~id : string ~status : string ~loginEmail : string ~email : string ~lastname : string ~firstname : string ~fullname : string ~nickname : string ~initials : string ~title : string ~jobTitle : string ~language : string ~country : string ~tags : Array ~internalPhoneNumber : string ~professionalPhoneNumber : string ~personalPhoneNumber : string ~personalMobilePhoneNumber : string ~professionalMobileNumber : string ~professionalMobileNumberCan : string ~voicemailNumber : string ~roles : Array ~customData : object ~pbxId : string ~displayOrder : string ~avatar : string ~userInfo1 : object ~userInfo2 : object ~company : object ~businessPhones : object ~mobilePhones : object ~isAlertNotificationEnabled : object ~calendarInformation : object ~fileSharingEnabled : boolean ~fileStorageEnabled : boolean ~instantMessagesEnabled : boolean ~bubblesEnabled : boolean ~webrtcAudioEnabled : boolean ~webrtcVideoEnabled : boolean ~webrtcSharingEnabled : boolean ~modifyProfileEnabled : boolean Contact~id : string Contact ID. This is a global reference of the contact, can be used as a parameter passed to multiple Rainbow Web SDK APIs Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~status : string Contact status. Can be one of the following values: "online", "dnd", "offline" or "unknown" Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~loginEmail : string Login email of the contact Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~email : string Email address associated with the account Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~lastname : string Contact's last name Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~firstname : string Contact's first name Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~fullname : string Contact's full name Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~nickname : string Contact's nickname Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~initials : string Contact's initials Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~title : string Contact's title Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~jobTitle : string Contact's job title Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~language : string Contact's language Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~country : string Contact's country Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~tags : Array Array of tags associated to the contact Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~internalPhoneNumber : string Contact's internal phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~professionalPhoneNumber : string Contact's professional phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~personalPhoneNumber : string Contact's personal phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~personalMobilePhoneNumber : string Contact's personal mobile phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~professionalMobileNumber : string Contact's professional mobile phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~professionalMobileNumberCan : string Contact's professional mobile phone number (in canonical format) Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~voicemailNumber : string Contact's voice mail number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~roles : Array Contact's voice mail number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~customData : object Custom data of the user. An object of custom properties that can be changed by company admin. Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~pbxId : string ID of the PBX associated with the user Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~displayOrder : string Indicator for the display order. Can be set to either "FL" (first name, last name) or "LF" (last name, first name) Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~avatar : string Source of the avatar (if any). Null if none. Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~userInfo1 : object Custom data attached to the user, can be modified by admin Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~user

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationContacts serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Contacts This service gives access to the information of the connected user and to all of his contacts. In addition, this service
content: DocumentationContacts serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Contacts This service gives access to the information of the connected user and to all of his contacts. In addition, this service manages the network of the connected user through invitations The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Retrieve the user connected information including his associated PBX phone if registered, - Retrieve the contacts information, - Search for contacts on the server, - Invite contacts, manage invitations, - Manage own contact list (roster), - Listen to the contacts information changes to be able to update your application if needed, - Listen to invitations coming from contacts Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONCONTACTINFORMATIONCHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONINFORMATIONCHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONCONTACTINVITATIONRECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONCONTACTINVITATIONNUMBERCHANGED Contacts getContactByJID(strJID) ⇒ object getContactById(contactId) ⇒ Promise getNetworkContacts() ⇒ Promise getAll() ⇒ Array getConnectedUser() ⇒ object getConnectedUserPhone() ⇒ object searchByName(strName, limit, addRosters, companyId, excludeCompanyId) ⇒ Promise searchPhonebook(strPattern) ⇒ Promise searchOffice365(strPattern) ⇒ Promise searchCompanyDirectory(strPattern, companyId) ⇒ Promise searchByLogin(strLogin) ⇒ Promise searchByJid(strJid) ⇒ Promise searchById(strId) ⇒ Promise acceptInvitation(invitationId) ⇒ Promise declineInvitation(invitationId) ⇒ Promise addToNetwork(contactId) ⇒ Promise sendInvitationByEmail(email, customMessage) ⇒ Promise removeFromNetwork(contactId) ⇒ Promise getInvitationById(invitationId) ⇒ object getInvitationsReceived() ⇒ Array cancelInvitation(invitationId) ⇒ Promise getInvitationsSent() ⇒ Array updateUserCustomData(customData) ⇒ Promise updateUserAutoDndCalendarSetting(activate) ⇒ Promise getUserAutoDndCalendarSetting() ⇒ boolean updateUserMSTeamsPresenceSetting(activate) ⇒ Promise getUserMSTeamsPresenceSetting() ⇒ boolean isCalendarSharingActivated() ⇒ boolean contacts.getContactByJID(strJID) ⇒ object Deprecated Get a contact by his JID locally from the network or from opened conversations. If the contact is not found, you can call the searchByJID() method to try to find it on server side. Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: object - Return a Contact object representing the contact information or null if no contact has been found Access: public ParamTypeDescription strJIDstringThe JID of the contact to get contacts.getContactById(contactId) ⇒ Promise Get a contact by his ID (dbId) locally from the network or from opened conversations. If the contact is not found, you can call the searchById() method to try to find him on server side. Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Promise - Return a promise containing a contact object representing the contact information or null if no contact has been found Access: public ParamTypeDescription contactIdstringThe ID of the contact to get contacts.getNetworkContacts() ⇒ Promise Returns a list of contacts that are in the network of the connected user Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Promise - A promise with an array of contacts found or an empty array if no contact has been found Access: public contacts.getAll() ⇒ Array Returns a list of users. It includes the contacts that are in the network of the connected user and the contacts that the connected user has opened conversation with. Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Array - Array of Contact object Access: public contacts.getConnectedUser() ⇒ object Get the connected user information Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: object - Contact object representing the connected user information or null if not connected Access: public contacts.getConnectedUserPhone() ⇒ object Get the connected user phone information or null if not exists Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: object - Object containing phoneNumber and pbxId keys Access: public contacts.searchByName(strName, limit, addRosters, companyId, excludeCompanyId) ⇒ Promise Search for a contact by name or firstname on the server. Depending the privacy rules, you can receive more or less information for each contact. Please refer to Rainbow for Developers privacy Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Promise - A promise with an array of contacts found or an empty array if no contact has been found Access: public ParamTypeDescription strNamestringThe beginning of the name or the first name to search limitnumberoptional, allow to specify the maximum number of contacts to retrieve. 20 by default. A maximum of 1000 results can be retrieved. addRostersboolean[optional] whether or not to include our contact roster in the search. Default: false companyIdstringID of company to search. Default = "" excludeCompanyIdstringID of company to search. Default = "" contacts.searchPhonebook(strPattern) ⇒ Promise Search for a contact in your Phonebook Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Promise - A promise with an array of contacts found

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationConversation modelLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 ConversationSDK Conversation model. Conversation is a representation of an interaction between a Rainbow user and another user,
content: DocumentationConversation modelLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 ConversationSDK Conversation model. Conversation is a representation of an interaction between a Rainbow user and another user, bubble or a call. A conversation never ends and all interactions done can be retrieved. ConversationSDK ~id : string ~type : number ~contactId : string ~bubbleId : string ~name : string ~name : string ~creationDate : Date ~lastModificiationDate : Date ~isFavorite : boolean ~messages : string ~lastMessage : string ConversationSDK~id : string The ID of the conversation. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~type : number The type of the conversation. Value 0 refers to one-to-one conversation, 1 to a bubble conversation and 2 to a call. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~contactId : string ID of the associated contact. In case of bubble conversation the value will default to 'null'. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~bubbleId : string ID of the bubble that the conversation is linked to, if any present. In case of one-to-one conversation the value will default to 'null'. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~name : string Name of the conversation - if conversation is of one-to-one type. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~name : string Name of a bubble, if the conversation is attached to a bubble. Otherwise, defaults to null. title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationConversations serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Conversations This module is the basic module for handling conversations in Rainbow. In Rainbow, conversations are the way to
content: DocumentationConversations serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Conversations This module is the basic module for handling conversations in Rainbow. In Rainbow, conversations are the way to get in touch with someone or something (i.e. a Rainbow contact, an external phone number, a connected thing) so a conversation is the "long tail" of communication between you and someone or something else like a bubble. A Rainbow conversation by default supports sending and receiving Instant Messages with a single recipient (one-to-one conversation) or with several persons (bubble). A conversation can be escaladed to audio and video or by adding a PBX phone call (for P2P conversation only). Using the FileStorage service, you can share files in conversations. The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Create or close a Rainbow conversation (one-to-one of bubble) - Retrieve all information linked to that conversation - Listen to the conversation change Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONCONVERSATIONCHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONCONVERSATIONREMOVED, event:RAINBOW_ONCONVERSATIONSCHANGED Conversations getAllConversations() ⇒ Array getCallById(strCallId) ⇒ object getConversationById(conversationId) ⇒ object getConversationByIdDeprecated(conversationId) ⇒ object getConversationByBubbleId(bubbleId) ⇒ Promise.<conversation> openConversationForContact(contact) ⇒ Promise getConversationByContactId(contactId) ⇒ Promise openConversationForBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise closeConversation(conversationId) closeConversationDeprecated(conversation) conversations.getAllConversations() ⇒ Array Allow to get the list of existing conversations (p2p and bubbles) Kind: instance method of Conversations Returns: Array - An array of Conversation objects Access: public conversations.getCallById(strCallId) ⇒ object Deprecated Get a call by its ID by searching through all the conversations Deprecated, please use getCallById API from WebRTC Service. Kind: instance method of Conversations Returns: object - The call if found or null in case no call was found Access: public ParamTypeDescription strCallIdstringID of the call conversations.getConversationById(conversationId) ⇒ object Get a conversation by its id (dbId field) Kind: instance method of Conversations Returns: object - A conversation object or null if not found Access: public ParamTypeDescription conversationIdstringID of the conversation conversations.getConversationByIdDeprecated(conversationId) ⇒ object Deprecated Get a conversation by its jid. Deprecated, please use getConversationById. Kind: instance method of Conversations Returns: object - A conversation object or null if not found Access: public ParamTypeDescription conversationIdstringjid of the conversation conversations.getConversationByBubbleId(bubbleId) ⇒ Promise.<conversation> Get a conversation associated to a bubble (using the bubble ID to retrieve it) Kind: instance method of Conversations Returns: Promise.<conversation> - A Promise with conversation object or null if not found Access: public ParamTypeDescription bubbleIdstringID of the bubble (dbId field) conversations.openConversationForContact(contact) ⇒ Promise Open a conversation to a contact. Deprecated. Please use getConversationByContactId. Create a new one if the conversation doesn't exist or reopen a closed conversation Kind: instance method of Conversations Returns: Promise - The Conversation (created or retrieved) or null in case of error Access: public ParamTypeDescription contactobjectThe contact involved in the conversation conversations.getConversationByContactId(contactId) ⇒ Promise Get conversation by contact ID. Kind: instance method of Conversations Returns: Promise - The Conversation (created or retrieved) or null in case of error Access: public ParamTypeDescription contactIdstringThe contact involved in the conversation conversations.openConversationForBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise Open a conversation for a bubble. Deprecated. Please use getConversationByBubbleId Kind: instance method of Conversations Returns: Promise - The Conversation (created or retrieved) or null in case of error Access: public ParamTypeDescription bubbleobjectThe bubble involved in this conversation conversations.closeConversation(conversationId) Close a conversation Kind: instance method of Conversations Access: public ParamTypeDescription conversationIdstringThe conversation to close conversations.closeConversationDeprecated(conversation) Close a conversation Kind: instance method of Conversations Access: public ParamTypeDescription conversationobjectThe conversation to close On this pageConversationsconversations.getAllConversations() ⇒ Arrayconversations.getCallById(strCallId) ⇒ objectconversations.getConversationById(conversationId) ⇒ objectconversations.getConversationByIdDeprecated(conversationId) ⇒ objectconversations.getConversationByBubbleId(bubbleId) ⇒ Promise.<conversation>conversations.openConversationForContact(contact) ⇒ Promiseconversations.getConversationByContact

This will result in sending an update event of type RAINBOW_ONNEWAUDIOVIDEODEVICESELECTED Kind: instance method of DeviceManagementService Access: public ParamTypeDescription deviceMediaDeviceInfoThe new device to be used; Should be of type videoinput deviceManagementService.getAllVideoInputDevices() ⇒ Array.<MediaDeviceInfo> Return all available video input devices (type MediaDeviceInfo) Kind: instance method of DeviceManagementService Returns: Array.<MediaDeviceInfo> - The list of all video inputs MediaDeviceInfo or [] Access: public deviceManagementService.getCurrentSecondaryOutputDevice() ⇒ MediaDeviceInfo Return the secondary output device to be used for incoming calls / IMs to play sound on Kind: inst

content: DocumentationFavorites serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Favorites This module is the basic module for handling Favorites in Rainbow. In Rainbow, Favorites are the way to list a most frequent, most used or the most important conversations, bubbles and bots. The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Create or delete a Rainbow Favorite (one-to-one, bubble or bot) - Retrieve all information linked to that Favorite Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONFAVORITECREATED, event:RAINBOW_ONFAVORITEDELETED Favorites fetchAllFavorites() ⇒ Promise createFavorite(id, favoriteType) ⇒ Promise deleteFavorite(id) ⇒ Promise favorites.fetchAllFavorites() ⇒ Promise Fetch all the Favorites from the server in a form of an Array Kind: instance method of Favorites Returns: Promise - Promise with an array of Favorite objects Access: public favorites.createFavorite(id, favoriteType) ⇒ Promise Add user/bubble/bot to Favorites Array Kind: instance method of Favorites Returns: Promise - Promise resolution Access: public ParamTypeDescription idstringID of the user/bubble favoriteTypestringType of Favorite (can be 'user' or 'bubble') favorites.deleteFavorite(id) ⇒ Promise Delete conversation/bubble/bot from Favorites Array Kind: instance method of Favorites Returns: Promise - Promise resolution Access: public ParamTypeDescription idstringID of the Favorite item On this pageFavoritesfavorites.fetchAllFavorites() ⇒ Promisefavorites.createFavorite(id, favoriteType) ⇒ Promisefavorites.deleteFavorite(id) ⇒ PromiseWas this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

content: DocumentationGroups serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Groups This service manages user groups in Rainbow. Each user can create groups and invite other Rainbow users to be part of it. Without being invited, users can join a bubble. The main methods proposed in that module allow to: - Get all groups of the user - Create a new group - Add a contact in a group - Remove a contact from a group - Delete an existing group Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONGROUPCREATED, event:RAINBOW_ONGROUPUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONGROUPDELETED, event:RAINBOW_ONGROUPUSERADDED, event:RAINBOW_ONGROUPUSERREMOVED Access: public Groups API createGroup(strName, strDescription, isFavorite) ⇒ Promise deleteGroup(group) ⇒ Promise deleteAllGroups() ⇒ Promise getAll() ⇒ Array getFavoritesGroup() ⇒ Array setGroupAsFavorite(group) ⇒ Promise getGroupById(groupId) ⇒ object getDetailedGroupById(id) ⇒ Promise addContactInGroup(contactId, group) ⇒ Promise removeContactFromGroup(contactId, group) ⇒ Promise EVENTS ~unsetGroupAsFavorite(group) ⇒ Promise groups.createGroup(strName, strDescription, isFavorite) ⇒ Promise Create a new group Return a promise. The favorited groups or an error object depending on the result Access: public groups.setGroupAsFavorite(group) ⇒ Promise Set a group as favorite Return a Promise Kind: instance method of Groups Returns: Promise - Promise resolution with the group updated Access: public ParamTypeDescription groupobjectThe group to set as favorite groups.getGroupById(groupId) ⇒ object Get user's group by id Kind: instance method of Groups Returns: object - The group found or null if not found Access: public ParamTypeDescription groupIdstringid of the group groups.getDetailedGroupById(id) ⇒ Promise Get the group with detailed information on users Kind: instance method of Groups Returns: Promise - The group updated Access: public ParamTypeDescription idstringThe group id groups.addContactInGroup(contactId, group) ⇒ Promise Add a contact to a group Kind: instance method of Groups Returns: Promise - content: DocumentationIM serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 IM This service sends and receives Instant Messages in one-to-one conversations or bubble conversations. The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Retrieve the messages already exchanged in a conversation, - Send a new message in a conversation (one-to-one conversation or bubble) - Listen when new messages are received in a conversation Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONNEWIMMESSAGERECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONNEWIMRECEIPTRECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONNEWPARTICIPANTSTATUS IM getMessagesFromConversation(conversationId, intNbMessage) ⇒ Promise getMessageFromConversationById(conversationId, strMessageId) ⇒ object getMessageFromBubbleById(bubble, strMessageId) ⇒ object sendMessageToConversation(conversationId, strMessage, additionalContentType, additionalContentMessage, urgency) ⇒ object sendCorrectedChatMessage(conversationId, strMessage, messageId) ⇒ object replyToMessage(conversationId, strMessage, answerMessageId) ⇒ Promise deleteMessage(conversationId, messageId) ⇒ object getLastModifiedText(conversationId, messageId) ⇒ string isMessageDeleted(conversationId, messageId) ⇒ boolean sendIsTypingStateInConversation(conversationId, status) ⇒ Promise sendMessageToBubble(bubble, strMessage, additionalContentType, additionalContentMessage, urgency) ⇒ Promise sendIsTypingStateInBubble(bubble, status) ⇒ object removeAllMessagesFromConversation(conversationId) ⇒ Promise markMessageFromConversationAsRead(conversationId, messageId) ⇒ object markAllMessagesFromConversationAsRead(conversationId) ⇒ object iM.getMessagesFromConversation(conversationId, intNbMessage) ⇒ Promise Retrieve the list of messages from a conversation Calling several times this method will load older messages from the history (pagination). Kind: instance method of IM Returns: Promise - Promise with the conversation updated with the list of messages requested or an error (reject) if there is no more messages to retrieve Access: public ParamTypeDescription conversationIdstringThe conversation ID intNbMessagenumberThe number of messages to retrieve. Optional. Default value is 30. Maximum value is 100 iM.getMessageFromConversationById(conversationId, strMessageId) ⇒ object Retrieve a specific message in a conversation using its id Kind: instance method of IM Returns: object - The message if found or null Access: public ParamTypeDescription conversationIdstringId of the conversation where to search for the message strMessageIdstringThe message id iM.getMessageFromBubbleById(bubble, strMessageId) ⇒ object Retrieve a specific message in a bubble using its id Kind: instance method of IM Returns: object - The message if found or null Access: public ParamTypeDescription bubbleobjectThe bubble where to search for the message strMessageIdstringThe message id iM.sendMessageToConversation(conversationId, strMessage, additionalContentType, additionalContentMessage, urgency) ⇒ object Send a instant message to a conversation This method works for sending messages to a one-to-one conversation or to a bubble conversation Kind: instance method of IM Returns: object - The message object created and sent or null in case of error Access: public ParamTypeDescription conversationIdstringID of the conversation object strMessagestringThe text message to send (limited to 1024 characters per message) additionalContentTypestring[optional] A string matching one of the two values: "text/markdown" (to show markdown) "form/json" (to show adaptive card on Rainbow clients) or 'rainbow/json' (to allow interactions in Rainbow clients) additionalContentMessagestring[optional] A string containing Alternative Content message (maximum 1024 characters) urgencystring[optional] A string defining the urgency of the message. Can be set to "high", "middle", "low" or "std". Defaults to 'std' iM.sendCorrectedChatMessage(conversationId, strMessage, messageId) ⇒ object Send a corrected chat message to a conversation This method allows the user to modify the given message and update its content Works only with the last message sent by the connected user Kind: instance method of IM Returns: object - - message object with updated replaceMsgs property Access: public ParamTypeDescription conversationIdstringID of the conversation strMessagestringThe text message to send (limited to 1024 characters per message) messageIdstringid of the message that is supposed to be corrected iM.replyToMessage(conversationId, strMessage, answerMessageId) ⇒ Promise Reply to a specific message in a conversation Kind: instance method of IM Returns: Promise - Promise resolution with a message object with updated replaceMsgs property Access: public ParamTypeDescription conversationIdstringThe conversation object strMessagestringThe text of the message to be sent (limited to 1024 characters per message) answerMessageIdstringID of the message that is to be answered to iM.deleteMessage(conversationId, messageId) ⇒ object Delete a message by specifying its ID. content: DocumentationMessage modelLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 MessageSDK Message model. Messages are exchanged between Rainbow users in one-to-one conversations or bubbles. MessageSDK ~additionalContent : object ~answeredMsgId : string ~id : string ~type : string ~data : string ~date : Date ~senderId : string ~isForwarded : boolean ~receiptStatus : number ~status : string ~urgency : string ~shortFileDescriptor : object ~fileId : string ~messageHistory : Array ~side : string MessageSDK~additionalContent : object Message alternative content Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~answeredMsgId : string ID of the messaged that was answered (if any) Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~id : string The ID of the message Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~type : string Message type. Can be one of the following values: - "Chat" - "File" - "FileSharing" - "FileSharing" - "WebRTC CAll" - "Recording" - "FORM" - "FORWARD" Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~data : string The message content Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~date : Date Message date Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~senderId : string ID of the Rainbow user who sent the message Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~isForwarded : boolean Boolean indicating if the message was forwarded Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~receiptStatus : number Status of the receipt Can be one of the following values: 0 - No receipt received yet 1 - No receipt received after a while, the server doesn't answer 2 - Receipt in progress 3 - The server has confirmed the reception of the message 4 - The message has been received but not read 5 - The message has been read Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~status : string Status of the message Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~urgency : string Urgency level. Can be one of the following values: 'std', 'low', 'middle', 'high' Kind: inner property of MessageSDK Access: public Read only: true MessageSDK~shortFileDescriptor : object Short file descriptor - if file is available and attached to the message. title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationTelephony serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Telephony This services manages PBX phone calls in a conversation. so it manages PBX calls between your PABX associated phone and
content: DocumentationTelephony serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Telephony This services manages PBX phone calls in a conversation. so it manages PBX calls between your PABX associated phone and a recipient's phone. If you don't have this service activated for your Rainbow user, all these methods will return an error when called. The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Know if this service is activated or not for the connected user, - Know the version of the agent (deployed on the PBX) that monitors your line, - Handle the basic telephony services: Make a call, take a call, hold a call, retrieve a call and release a call, - Listen to the call state change Depending the agent version deployed, some services can return an error (unavailable service) when called Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONTELEPHONYSTARTED, event:RAINBOW_ONTELEPHONYSTOPPED, event:RAINBOW_ONTELEPHONYCALLSTATECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONVOIPCALLSTATECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONTELEPHONYFORWARDSTATECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONCALLNOMADICEVENT, event:RAINBOW_ONVOIPSTARTED, event:RAINBOW_ONVOIPSTOPPED, event:RAINBOW_ONVOICEMESSAGEUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_TELEPHONYMUTE, event:RAINBOW_ONTELEPHONYMODEUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONFORWARDMODEUPDATED Telephony isTelephonyAvailable() ⇒ boolean isVoiceMailConfigured() ⇒ boolean getAgentVersion() ⇒ string getXMPPAgentStatus() ⇒ string getPhoneAPIStatus() ⇒ string makeCall1PCC(strPhoneNumber, contactId) ⇒ Promise makeCall(contactId, strPhoneNumber, callSubject, correlatorData, correlatorDataHex) ⇒ Promise callByNumber(strPhoneNumber) ⇒ Promise callWithMessage(contactId, strPhoneNumber, callSubject, correlatorData) ⇒ Promise strForwardType) ⇒ Promise forwardToVoicemail(strForwardType) ⇒ Promise cancelForward() ⇒ Promise getForwardStatusFromServer() ⇒ Promise getForwardStatus() ⇒ object answer(call) ⇒ Promise hold(call) ⇒ Promise retrieve(call) ⇒ Promise transferCall(activeCall, heldCall) ⇒ Promise conferenceCall(activeCall, heldCall) ⇒ Promise fetchVoiceMailMessagesNumber() ⇒ Promise muteCall(call, conversation) ⇒ void unmuteCall(call, conversation) ⇒ void getTelephonyMode() ⇒ TelephonyMode setTelephonyMode(telephonyMode) ⇒ Promise nomadicLogin(phoneNumber, isUnchangeableNumber, notTakeIntoAccount) ⇒ Promise nomadicLogout() ⇒ Promise getNomadicState() ⇒ Promise setExternalNomadicNumber(phoneNumber) ⇒ Promise setNomadicOfficePhone(ringOnlyOfficePhone) ⇒ Promise setNomadicVoIP() ⇒ Promise isDeskPhoneAvailable() ⇒ boolean isVoIPAvailable() ⇒ boolean logonCCD(endpointTel, agentId, password, groupId, routingDestination, routing) ⇒ Promise logoffCCD(endpointTel, agentId, password, groupId) ⇒ Promise withdrawalCCD(agentId, groupId, status) ⇒ Promise wrapupCCD(agentId, groupId, password, status) ⇒ Promise subscribeToCCDEvents(handler) ⇒ Subscription getCurrentCCDAgentStatus() ⇒ object title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationPresence serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Presence This service manages with your Rainbow presence and the presence of your contacts. The presence in Rainbow reflects your
content: DocumentationPresence serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 Presence This service manages with your Rainbow presence and the presence of your contacts. The presence in Rainbow reflects your activity or the possibility or not to be joined in a conversation (using IM, an audio/video call or a PBX call). The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Retrieve and set the presence of the connected user, - Retrieve the presence of the contacts, - Listen to the contacts presence change Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONPRESENCECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONCONTACTPRESENCECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONRICHPRESENCECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONCONTACTRICHPRESENCECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONMYCONTACTPRESENCECHANGED presence.setPresenceTo(strPresenceState) ⇒ object Allow to change the presence of the connected user manually Only the following values are authorized: RAINBOW_PRESENCE_ONLINE, RAINBOW_PRESENCE_OFFLINE (invisible), RAINBOW_PRESENCE_DONOTDISTURB or RAINBOW_PRESENCE_AWAY Kind: instance method of Presence Returns: object - Return the SDK OK object in case of success or an SDK error object Access: public ParamTypeDescription strPresenceStatestringThe presence value to set i.e: 'online', 'xa', or 'dnd' On this pagePresencepresence.setPresenceTo(strPresenceState) ⇒ objectWas this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

Default value: 50 Allowed values: [1;50] formatstring[optional] Allows to retrieve more or less user details in response. - small: id displayName companyName companyId jid_im isTerminated lastName firstName - medium: id displayName companyName companyId jid_im jid_tel isTerminated lastAvatarUpdateDate lastUpdateDate lastName firstName guestMode - full: id displayName companyName companyId loginEmail nickName title jobTitle country language timezone jid_im jid_tel isTerminated lastAvatarUpdateDate lastUpdateDate roles phoneNumbers emails lastName firstName guestMode lastOfflineMailReceivedDate Default value: small Allowed values: small, medium, full getSuggestedContactsLargeCompany This API allows to list users network suggestions(excludeIds, limit, offset, department, jobtitle, tags, more, format) ⇒ Promise.<any> Method getSuggestedContactsLargeCompany Kind: global function Returns: Promise.<any> - List of user's network suggestions Access: public ParamTypeDescription excludeIdsArray.<string>[optional] Array of user ids to exclude from suggestions limitnumber[optional] Allow to specify the number of suggestions to retrieve. Default value: 20 offsetnumber[optional] Allow to specify the position of first suggestion to retrieve (first suggestion if not specified). Default value: 0 departmentboolean[optional] Allow to retrieve only department based suggestions. Default value: false jobtitleboolean[optional] Allow to retrieve only jobtitle based suggestions. Default value: false tagsboolean[optional] Allow to retrieve only tags based suggestions. Default value: false moreboolean[optional] Allow to retrieve only default based suggestions (creation date). The WebConferenceParticipant (if found) by his id Access: public ParamTypeDescription idstringthe DbId of the contact webConferenceSession.isLock() ⇒ boolean Check if the current web conference is locked. In case it's locked, no other user is allowed to join it Kind: instance method of WebConferenceSession Returns: boolean - Return a boolean value indicating whether the web conference is currently locked Access: public webConferenceSession.getParticipantsListWithDelegateCapability() ⇒ Array Get the list of participants to whom we can delegate the current conference. content: DocumentationWeb Conference service (v2)LTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 WebConferenceServiceV2 This service manages web conferences in Rainbow (web conferences that take place in bubbles). Any Rainbow user in the bubble can take part of the conference (the maximum number of participants is based on the licence of the organiser of the conference) In each conference, there's only one "organizer" (the user that has started the conference), but every administrator in the bubble is allowed to make additional actions on all other participants (like drop, mute, etc) Only the organizer of the conference can stop the conference, or delegate it to another user. By default, the web conference service is going to use a web conference helper service that will manage an automatic subscription to all available videos, the management of the dynamic feed. This service configuration can be managed by setHelperServiceConfiguration API NB !! The CPU and bandwidth consumption should/can be managed via additionnal APIs that can be used so that the application is adapted; As all incoming videos are available in 3 sublayers (high HD, medium VGA and low QVGA) the user can change the sublayer he wants to receive from the server (managed by the Method updateParticipant) In addition, some session can be put on hold / unhold so that the user can "pause" all incoming videos that are not needed at the moment (managed by putRemoteVideoSessionOnHold) Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONWEBCONFERENCESTATUSUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBCONFERENCEPARTICIPANTLISTUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBCONFERENCEPUBLISHERSADDED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBCONFERENCEPUBLISHERSREMOVED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBCONFERENCELOCKSTATEUPDATED, content: DocumentationWebRTC serviceLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21 WebRTC This module manages WebRTC audio and video communication in a conversation. At this time of writing, only Chrome and Firefox browsers support these services in Rainbow. The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Know if your application (in fact your browser) can use these services, - Detect if a webcam or at least a microphone is available, - Handle the basic audio video services: Call a contact in audio or in audio and video and release the call, - Allow to show and hide the local and remote video, - Mute and unmute audio and video stream, - Listen to the call state change, - Record a call - Enumerate the available devices and allow to select the ones to use You have to use the media device selector proposed by your browser in order to select the device to use when in communication (Firefox) or you will use the default configured device (Chrome) Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCCALLSTATECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCERRORHANDLED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCSTREAMADDED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCTRACKCHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHROMESTOPSCREENSHARINGTRIGGERED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCTMEDIAERROROCCURED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCTRECORDDONE, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCTRECORDERROR, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCTRECORDSTARTED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCTRECORDSTOPPED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCTRECORDREMOTESTARTED, event:RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCTRECORDREMOTESTOPPED WebRTC canMakeAudioVideoCall() ⇒ boolean hasAMicrophone() ⇒ boolean hasACamera() ⇒ boolean callInAudio(contactId, [subject]) ⇒ Promise callInVideo(contactId, [subject]) ⇒ Promise callInSharing(contactId) ⇒ Promise callinAudioWithSharing(contactId) ⇒ Promise answerInAudio(callId) ⇒ object answerInVideo(callId) ⇒ object getPeerConnectionForCall(callId) ⇒ object showLocalVideo() ⇒ object hideLocalVideo() ⇒ object showRemoteVideo(callId) ⇒ object hideRemoteVideo(callId) ⇒ object addVideoToCall(callId) ⇒ object addSharingToCall(callId) ⇒ object removeVideoFromCall(callId) ⇒ object removeSharingFromCall(callId) ⇒ object release(callId) ⇒ object muteAudioCall(callId) ⇒ object unmuteAudioCall(callId) ⇒ object getLocalStreamsFromCall(callId) ⇒ Array.<MediaStream> getRemoteStreamsFromCall(callId) ⇒ object getCallById(callId) ⇒ CallSDK | Call canMakeDesktopSharingCall() ⇒ object startRecording(callId, fileName, [recordRemote], [toUpload], [onlyAudio], [mimeType]) ⇒ object stopRecording(callId) ⇒ object webRTC.canMakeAudioVideoCall() ⇒ boolean Return true if the browser can use WebRTC to make audio and video call AND the page uses HTTPS protocol Kind: instance method of WebRTC Returns: boolean - True if audio and video calls are supported Access: public webRTC.hasAMicrophone() ⇒ boolean Return true if at least one microphone is detected and can be used Kind: instance method of WebRTC Returns: boolean - True if a microphone has been detected Access: public webRTC.hasACamera() ⇒ boolean Return true if at least one camera is detected and can be used Kind: instance method of WebRTC Returns: boolean - True if a camera has been detected webRTC.callInAudio(contactId, [subject]) ⇒ Promise Call a contact in audio only using WebRTC canMakeAudioVideoCall() must be true Not supported on IE 11 Kind: instance method of WebRTC Returns: Promise - Return the SDK OK object in case of success or an SDK error object Access: public SDK error object Access: public ParamTypeDefaultDescription contactIdstringID of the contact to call in video [subject]string[optional] add a subject/correlator to the call
