excerpt: DocumentationManage Audio and Video callsMANAGING AUDIO AND VIDEO CALLS Preamble Using Rainbow React Native SDK, you can make audio and video calls to your contacts thanks to Webrtc. This tutorial wil
content: DocumentationManage Audio and Video callsMANAGING AUDIO AND VIDEO CALLS Preamble Using Rainbow React Native SDK, you can make audio and video calls to your contacts thanks to Webrtc. This tutorial will help you understanding how it works and will give you the hints for adding the possibility in your application to communicate in audio and video successfully. You can Also start a Webrtc Conference and screen sharing in a your bubble.For more details on this check Managing Conferences RAINBOW KNOWLEDGE Here are some Rainbow wordings that will help you understanding this guide. Rainbow conceptDetails A peerA peer is a participant of a call in a peer-to-peer call or in a conference call. WebRTC Peer to Peer CallThis is a call between two users[caller and the callee or the recipient. An audio only CallAn audio only call uses only the microphone for dispatching the audio to the recipient An Video callA video call uses the camera for dispatching both audio and video legs to the recipient A sharing callA sharing call uses the screen or an application for dispatching a data leg to the recipient. The call can be initiated with or without an audio leg. The audio leg can be added during the call. Escalate to video callWhen in an audio call, you can decide at any time to add a video leg with your recipients Lock conference callwhen you initiate a conference call you can lock it to prevent other participant from joining the call. Check lock conferences section Delegate Conference CallThe initiator of the conference call can delegate the control to another attendee then leave the conference. Check Delegate conferences section WebRTC Conference callThis is a call between two or more users in a bubble. Check Managing Conferences In our example app, we provided a sample code on how you can handle your webrtc calls and manage conference calls. Webrtc CALLS [Peer To Peer Call] Rainbow React Native SDK manage the webrtc[Audio/video] calls for you. Its able to handle only one WebRTC call at a time. RN SDK provide a customizable components for each peer to peer (p2p) webrtc call and allow you to customize the call view and actions buttons based on your app needs. In this tutorial we will talking bout the following: How to use Peer To Peer Call Component. Listen to the peer to peer event: EventType.P2PCallUpdated. Get more detail bout P2PCallView for the peer to peer UI view and how to add your customization to it. Get more detail bout P2PActionsView for the peer tp peer action buttons and how to add your customization to it. Get more detail bout P2P Video Streams for the peer tp peer video calls including: remote video, local video and screen sharing video and how to add your customization to it. How to use This example bellow will show to you how to use P2P Call in general and simple way. If you wanna more detail how to use it, you can check the Sample Code. Please Note: in the Sample Code we listen beside the event EventType.P2PCallUpdated we listen to EventType.GetCurrentCall event too. And the reason that we need to get the current call after retrieving the call view, please read this link for more info Retrieve Active Call View. import { Body, Container, Header, Text } from 'native-base'; import React, { FunctionComponent, useEffect, useState } from 'react'; import {View} from 'react-native'; import { P2PCallView, IP2PCall, P2PCallActions, eventEmitter, EventType, CallTypeName, } from 'react-native-rainbow-module'; const P2PCall: FunctionComponent<IProps> = ({}) => { const [p2pCall, setP2PCall] = useState<IP2PCall>(); useEffect(() => { // Listen to call updated event including call added , modified and removed const callUpdatedListener = eventEmitter.addListener(EventType.P2PCallUpdated, (call?: IP2PCall) => { logger.info(`updateCurrentCall ${call?.callId}`); setP2PCall(call); }); return () => { callUpdatedListener.remove(); }; }); // Check if there is a valid P2P Call to show it to the user. if (p2pCall) { return ( <Container> <Header> <Body> <Text >{p2pCall.callPeer.name}</Text> </Body> </Header > <View > <P2PCallView call={p2pCall} renderActiveCallView={renderActiveCallView} /> <P2PCallActions call={p2pCall} renderIncomingP2PCallActions={renderIncomingCallActions} /> </View> </Container> ); } else return null; } Peer To Peer Call Screenshot P2P Updated Events: First, you need to listen to the P2P update call event EventType.P2PCallUpdated that triggers on call updated (added, modified, removed), where the result will be as IP2PCall. const peerToPeerCallUpdatedListener = eventEmitter.addListener(EventType.P2PCallUpdated, (call?: IP2PCall) => { // incase of the removed call, the call event will be `undefined` setP2PCall(call); }); P2P Call View Rainbow RN SDk provide you a resumable component for p2p call view, that handle the incoming, active and outgoing view for the webrtc call. In addition it allow you to override the default style and view and add your own view customization. #NameTypeDescription 1callIP2PCallThe p2p c

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationManage callsRetrieve Calls Setup iOS Environment Setup iOS Environment Register Call App Register Call App Peer To Peer Call Button MakeCallButton Setup iOS Environment For the iOS side y
content: DocumentationManage callsRetrieve Calls Setup iOS Environment Setup iOS Environment Register Call App Register Call App Peer To Peer Call Button MakeCallButton Setup iOS Environment For the iOS side you need to follow the instructions in the following link, otherwise it WON'T works on the iOS. First you need to setup the app permission: SET-UP THE APPLICATION AUTHORIZATIONS. Then you need to setup the VOIP certificate: VoIP Services Certificate. Register Call App Before building any of the Call components, you have to register the callApp when your app starts inside index.js. And inside the callApp you can use any call component you want to support whatever its a P2P Call, Conference Call, or PBX Call. And the purpose of separate the CallApp from all other app components because we wanna make sure that when the call is active there is No other component that can interfere with the call. If you wanna more detail how to use it, you can check the Sample Code. Incase you wanna know to make ConferenceCallComponent, please check the Managing Conferences and Conference Services. To know more about how to manage your WebRTC peer to peer calls. please check Managing Audio and Video calls. const CallApp = () => ( <RainbowProvider> <ConferenceCallComponent /> <P2PCall /> </RainbowProvider> ); const registerRainbowCallApp = () => registerRainbowCallComponents(() => CallApp); where you need to call registerRainbowCallApp into your App index.js. Peer To Peer Call Button After you are successfully set up Rainbow Contacts you can initiate your calls towards your them. Rainbow RN SDK provide you a customizable component <CallButton /> with some props to be passed. Check table below Available props #NameNotesDefaultDescription 1webRtcActionsIWebRtcCallActionProps‘none’This action provides you the audio and video service 2contactIContact‘none’The contact object you wish to make the call services 3pbxEnabledBooleantrueEnable the PBX calling? 4webrtcEnabledBooleantrueEnable the Audio and Video calling? 5image sourceImageSourcePropType‘none’The image URL for showing the call logo button 6style[ViewStyle,ImageStyle]default styleCustoms style for components style props Through pbxEnabled and webrtcEnabled you can decide to enable/disable both services. Through Style props, you can customize the component UI. In our example, we used this MakeCallButton in the Contact Information page and show the call button for this user. import React from 'react'; import componentConfig from '../component-config.json'; import { CallButton, IImageButtonStyleProps, IContact, IPbxCallActionProps, IWebRtcCallActionProps } from 'react-native-rainbow-module' import videoCall from './videoCall.png'; interface ICallComponentProps { contact: IContact; showDialog: boolean; openDialog: () => void; } const customStyle: IImageButtonStyleProps = { image: { width: 60, height: 60 } }; export const webRtcActions: IWebRtcCallActionProps[] = [ { callType: 'video', actionName: 'video', iconName: 'videocam' }, { callType: 'audio', actionName: 'audio', iconName: 'headset' } ]; export const PbxActions: IPbxCallActionProps = { enablePbxCalls: true }; export const CallComponent: React.FunctionComponent<ICallComponentProps> = ({ contact }) => { return ( <CallButton imageSource={videoCall} style={customStyle} webRtcActions={webRtcActions} PbxActions={PbxActions} contact={contact} pbxEnabled={componentConfig.calls.pbxEnabled} webrtcEnabled={componentConfig.calls.webRtcEnabled} /> ); }; On this pageRetrieve CallsSetup iOS EnvironmentRegister Call AppPeer To Peer Call ButtonWas this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationManage contactsManaging Contacts Overview The Contacts feature allows you to manage and interact with the user's contact list. This guide shows how to retrieve, display, and interact with
content: DocumentationManage contactsManaging Contacts Overview The Contacts feature allows you to manage and interact with the user's contact list. This guide shows how to retrieve, display, and interact with contacts in your application. Features Retrieve the complete contact list Get real-time updates when contacts change Access detailed contact information Handle contact presence updates Removing contacts they no longer wish to be connected with. How It Works The contact management system is asynchronous. You will typically call a method from the contactsService to initiate an action (like fetching contacts), and then listen for a specific event to receive the result. This event-driven architecture ensures that your application's UI remains responsive while data is being fetched over the network. Basic Usage Retrieving Contacts import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { View, Text, FlatList } from 'react-native'; import { eventEmitter, EventType, IContact, startUpService } from 'react-native-rainbow-module'; interface ContactItemProps { contact: IContact; } export const ContactsComponent: React.FC = () => { const [contacts, setContacts] = useState<IContact[]>([]); useEffect(() => { // Initial fetch of contacts startUpService.getRosterContacts(); // Subscribe to contact updates const contactsUpdated = eventEmitter.addListener( EventType.ContactsUpdated, (updatedContacts: IContact[]) => { setContacts(updatedContacts); } ); // Cleanup listener on component unmount return () => { contactsUpdated.remove(); }; }, []); const renderItems = (item: IContact) => { return <ContactCardView contact={item} rightItem={contactCardRightComponent(item)} />; } const renderEmptyList = () => ( <View style={{ flex: 1, justifyContent: 'center', alignItems: 'center' }}> <Text>No contacts found</Text> </View> ); return( <Contacts contacts={contacts} renderItems={renderItems} renderEmptyList={renderEmptyList} /> ) }; Next Steps To see how to implement these features in your application, please refer to the detailed Contact Services API Reference.. On this pageOverviewFeaturesHow It WorksBasic UsageRetrieving ContactsNext StepsWas this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

excerpt: DocumentationManage conversationsRetrieve Conversation This guide explains how to retrieve the list of conversations (P2P or Bubble). Preamble This guide will show you how to retrieve the list of conv
content: DocumentationManage conversationsRetrieve Conversation This guide explains how to retrieve the list of conversations (P2P or Bubble). Preamble This guide will show you how to retrieve the list of conversations in your network. To retrieve all active conversations (one-to-one and bubbles), all you need to do is import the component <Conversations /> from the Rainbow RN library. Then you need to add some props as shown in the following table. Available props #NameTypeDescription 1conversationsIConversation[]Conversations list 2styleIConversationStylePropsConversations list view style 3cellWidthnumberWidth of row in conversations list 4cellHeightnumberHeight of row in conversations list 5renderItems(item: IConversation) => React.ReactElementRender conversation items, where you can use our ConversationCard or you can just build your own view 6renderEmptyList() => React.ReactElementRender the view when the conversations list is empty How to use: import React, { FunctionComponent, useEffect, useState } from 'react'; import { Content, Text } from 'native-base'; import { IBubble, conversationsService, IConversation, eventEmitter, EventType, Conversations, ConversationCard } from 'react-native-rainbow-module'; import { Actions } from 'react-native-router-flux'; import { Strings } from '../resources/localization/Strings'; export const ConversationsComponent: FunctionComponent = () => { const [conversations, setConversations] = useState<IConversation[]>([]); useEffect(() => { //Get all conversations using conversations services conversationsService.getConversations(); //Listen to conversation list changes const conversationsUpdated = eventEmitter.addListener( EventType.ConversationsUpdated, (eventData: IConversation[]) => { setConversations(eventData); } ); return () => { conversationsUpdated.remove(); }; }, []); const onClickItem = (conversation: IConversation) => { if (conversation.bubble) { const bubble: IBubble = conversation.bubble Actions.BubbleChatView({ bubble }); } else { Actions.PeerConversationChatView({ conversation, }); } }; const renderEmptyList = () => { return ( <Content> <Text note={true} style={defaultStyle.NoDataMessages}> {Strings.noDataFound} </Text> </Content> ); } const renderItems = (item: IConversation) => { return <ConversationCard conversation={item} onClickItem={onClickItem} /> } return ( <Conversations conversations={conversations} renderItems={renderItems} renderEmptyList={renderEmptyList} /> ); } ConversationCard: We make a Conversation Card view just to make it easy to you to build the conversation list by using the renderItems method inside the Conversations list, please check the following props for the Conversation Card: #NameTypeDescription 1conversationIConversationThe conversation object you wanna show in the card view 2styleIConversationCardStylePropsCustomize style for the conversation card 3onClickItem(conversation: IConversation) => voidCallback method when there is a click on the conversation card On this pageRetrieve ConversationPreambleWas this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationSearchRetrieve Search Preamble This guide explains how to manage the Search for Rainbow contacts,conversation or Bubbles ...etc. So basically we build two component foe the search: Search
content: DocumentationSearchRetrieve Search Preamble This guide explains how to manage the Search for Rainbow contacts,conversation or Bubbles ...etc. So basically we build two component foe the search: Search Bar Input and the Search Result View. Search Bar input. This will show you a search text input. #NameNotesDefaultDescription 1onSearchUpdated(value: boolean, searchQuery: string): voidnonehandle when the search text is updated 2onCancelSearch() => voidnonehandle when canceling the search 3registerBackButtonHandler(handler: IBackButtonHandler) => voidnoneused for registering the back button in the search bar We usually put the Search Bar input in the header [as its show in the Search Input Example] Search Result View. This will show you the search result from the Search Bar Input. You can filter the result depending on your selected by enabling/disabling some feature as the following table: #NameNotesDefaultDescription 1search peoplebooleantruedoes the Contacts wanted to be included in the search? 2search conversationsbooleanfalsedoes the Conversation wanted to be included in the search? 3search bubblebooleanfalsedoes the Bubbles wanted to be included in the search? 4search channelsbooleanfalsedoes the Channels wanted to be included in the search? 5search companiesbooleanfalsedoes the Companies wanted to be included in the search? 6onClickItem(contact:IContact)=>voidnoneCallback function to handle when the user click on the contact search result. In the example below handle the clicking event by open the Contact info 7contactActionsProviderIActionsProvidernoneCallback function to handle when the user click on the contact Call Button in the search result. In the example below handle the clicking event by opening a call option dialog 8styleISearchStylePropsdefault stylecustomer style for components style props provide by ISearchStyleProps Search Bar input Example. import React, { FunctionComponent } from 'react'; import { SearchBarInput,IBackButtonHandler } from 'react-native-rainbow-module'; const handlers: IBackButtonHandler[] = []; const registerBackButtonHandler = (handler: IBackButtonHandler) => { handlers.push(handler); return () => { const index = handlers.indexOf(handler); if (index >= 0) { handlers.splice(index); } else { logger.error('Failed to unregistered handler; handler not found'); } }; }; const cancelSearch = () => { if (isSearchMode && Actions.currentScene === 'contactInformation') { console.info('onBackButtonPressed handled by home, exit contact Card details and back to the search'); Actions.pop(); return true; } if (isSearchMode) { logger.info('onBackButtonPressed handled by home, exit searchMode'); setIsSearchMode(false); if (searchQuery) { // To do clear input value on back button pressed. } else { setIsSearchMode(false); } return true; } return false; }; const updateHomeSearchState = (value: boolean, searchQuery: string) => { setIsSearchMode(value); setSearchQuery(searchQuery); }; return ( <React.Fragment> <Header leftComponent={renderHeaderLeftIcon} centerComponent={renderHeaderCenter} containerStyle={{ paddingTop: 10, paddingBottom: 10 }} /> {isSearchMode && searchComponent} {!isSearchMode && renderTab()} ... </React.Fragment> ); }; Search Result View Example. import { View } from 'react-native'; import React, { useState } from 'react'; import { OpenCallDialogComponent, PbxActions } from './CallComponent'; import { createCallPbxContactAction, IAction, IActionsProvider, IContact, Search, } from 'react-native-rainbow-module'; export const SearchComponent: React.FunctionComponent = ({navigation}) => { const [showDialog, setShowDialog] = useState<boolean>(false); const [contactToCall, setContactToCall] = useState<IContact>(); const openDialog = () => { setShowDialog(!showDialog); }; const actions: IAction[] = [ createCallPbxContactAction((contact) => { setContactToCall(contact); openDialog(); }), ]; const contactActionsProvider: IActionsProvider = new (class { public getActions = (contact: IContact) => { return actions; }; })(); const handleClickItem = (contact: IContact) => { navigation.navigate('ContactInformation', {contact}) }; return ( <View> <Search searchPeople={true} contactActionsProvider={contactActionsProvider} onClickItem={handleClickItem} /> {contactToCall && ( <OpenCallDialogComponent contact={contactToCall} showDialog={showDialog} openDialog={openDialog} callDialogWebRtcActions={[]} callDialogPbxActions={PbxActions} /> )} </View> ); }; On this pageRetrieve SearchPreambleSearch Bar input.Search Result View.Search Bar input Example.Search Result View Example.Was this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationSharing filesShow Shared File For Peer This guide explains how to show all the shared files for Peer (Conversation, Bubble) by using using <SharedFiles /> component. Preamble This tutoria
content: DocumentationSharing filesShow Shared File For Peer This guide explains how to show all the shared files for Peer (Conversation, Bubble) by using using <SharedFiles /> component. Preamble This tutorial will explain how to use the<SharedFiles /> component that used to render the sharing files in Rainbow. Also, you can check Shared Files Service, to see all the supported shared file services. Shared Files Available props: #NameTypeDescription 1peerIPeerthe peer object its could be a conversation type or bubble type 2onFileItemClicked(item: IFile) => void[Optional] callback method when one of the files item clicked 3renderFilesItems(files: IFile[]) => React.ReactElement[Optional] you can call this method when you want to call your own custom list view 4onEndReached() => void[optional] callback method when the user scrolled to end of the list. 5sharedFileArrayIFile[]All the files you have sent or received via rainbow 6isLoading() => voidflag for fetching file How To Use: First you should fetch your shared files by calling the method fetchAllSharedFilesInPeer(peerId: string, isBubble: boolean) from SharedFilesService. And you need to listen for fetching the files result by using EventType.GetAllSharedFileWithPeerResult event. After you successfully got the shared files array you need to import the <SharedFiles ..props /> from the RN sdk npm package and pass some requited props as explained above in the table. The SharedFils component will render the files list you share through the provided peer(conversation or bubble) using a RecyclerListView. if you want to customize the files list or you want to use another list view you can call the optional method renderFilesItems(). You can check the file information details [file size, name, extension, owner and the file viewers] by clicking on file from the rendered list, then a new view will open shows all the file details. You can control on how you want to view these information by calling the method onFileItemClicked?: (item: IFile) import { IPeer, SharedFiles, IFile } from 'react-native-rainbow-module'; ... ... const [sharedFileArray, setSharedFileArray] = useState<IFile[]>([]); const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState<boolean>(true); const isBubble = peer.type === PeerType.Bubble; useEffect(() => { sharedFilesService.fetchAllSharedFilesInPeer(peer.jId, isBubble); const sharedFileWithPeerResult = eventEmitter.addListener( EventType.GetAllSharedFileWithPeerResult, (eventData: IFile[]) => { console.log(`GetAllSharedFileWithPeerResult with file count ${eventData.length}`); setSharedFileArray(eventData); setIsLoading(false); } ); return () => { sharedFileWithPeerResult.remove(); } }, [isBubble, peer]); const renderOnFileClicked = (selectedFile: IFile) => { // Go the the file description view, for example! Actions.FileDescription({ file: selectedFile }); } const renderCustomFilesList = (files: IFile[]) => { // If you want another list than the RecyclerListView we used in the `SharedFiles` component to // render the shared files return <Text> you should pass your custom list here! </Text>; } return ( <View style={{flex: 1}} > <SharedFiles peer={peer} onFileItemClicked={renderOnFileClicked} renderFilesItems={renderCustomFilesList} sharedFileArray={sharedFileArray} isLoading={isLoading} /> </View> ); You can check this example for more detail about how to use the SharedFiles. Sort file by [name, date and size]: After you fetch all your shared files , you can sort them by name, size or date.You can check how we did the sort in our Example code On this pageShow Shared File For PeerPreambleShared Files Available props:How To Use:Sort file by [name, date and size]:Was this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

excerpt: DocumentationConnecting to RainbowConnect to Rainbow S2S Starter kit core engine connects to Rainbow using provided configuration file in json format. Copy Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS/config/Starter
content: DocumentationConnecting to RainbowConnect to Rainbow S2S Starter kit core engine connects to Rainbow using provided configuration file in json format. Copy Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS/config/StarterKitConfig.json.sample to your project and rename it as you want (for example myStarterKitProjectConfig.json ). Modify myStarterKitProjectConfig.json according to your registration parameters on the Hub web site. In configuration file some parameters are related to your credentials and allow to target the Rainbow Cloud Services server to use. // Update your myStarterKitProjectConfig.json configuration file { "rainbow": { "host": "sandbox", }, "credentials": { "login": "bot@mycompany.com", // To replace by your developer credendials "password": "xxxxxxxx" // To replace by your developer credentials }, // Application identifier "application": { "appID": "", // To repmace with your applicationID "appSecret": "", // To replace with your app secret key }, // Logs options "logs": { "enableConsoleLogs": true, "enableFileLogs": false, "file": { "path": '/var/tmp/rainbowsdk/', "level": 'debug' } }, // IM options "im": { "sendReadReceipt": false } ... } Connecting to Rainbow To connect to Rainbow, you first need to initialize the S2S Starter kit module - cf. Getting Started 'use strict'; const S2SStarterKit = require('Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS'); const starterKitConfig = require('./config/myStarterKitProjectConfig.json'); const myS2SStarterKit = new S2SStarterKit(starterKitConfig); (async() => { try { await myS2SStarterKit.start().then((data) => { // when start method is called, the S2S dev kit core engine connects to rainbow }).catch((e) => { console.error(e); myS2SStarterKit.stop(); }); } catch (ex) { console.log(ex); } })(); On this pageConnect to RainbowConnecting to RainbowWas this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

excerpt: DocumentationDevelopment KitS2S Starter Kit The Rainbow S2S Starter Kit contains: Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS package witch provides an S2S Starter kit engine core with Services bots can use to inte
content: DocumentationDevelopment KitS2S Starter Kit The Rainbow S2S Starter Kit contains: Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS package witch provides an S2S Starter kit engine core with Services bots can use to interact with rainbow platform. For the moment ImService and Pesence Service are availabe. A webhook module that publishes rainbow platform notification and events to S2S Starter kit engine core. User can use them as callback events in response to some actions. Several applications samples to show how to use it. Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS The Rainbow S2S Starter Kit is available from Github. See the Getting started guide to understand how to load it. Appplications samples Applications samples are available on Github. They are intended to show how to implement bots or services using Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS package. You can have access to bot samples by cloning the GitHub project: Rainbow-S2S-Samples You will find : Rainbow-S2S-Sample-CountryBot This sample shows how to get basic country information from a chatbot that interacts with a third party webservice to serve the requested information. Rainbow-S2S-Sample-PhpEchoBot This sample shows how to implement a PHP bot using PHP generated S2S client API and Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS for notification events. Rainbow-S2S-Sample-JavaEchoBot This sample shows how to implement a Java bot using Java generated S2S client API and Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS for notification events. On this pageS2S Starter KitRainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJSAppplications samplesWas this content helpful to you?YesNoFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationGetting startedGetting started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow Software S2S Starterkit (Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS) for NodeJS and other languages. The Alcatel-Lucent
content: DocumentationGetting startedGetting started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow Software S2S Starterkit (Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS) for NodeJS and other languages. The Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise (ALE) Rainbow Software Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS is a nodejs tool provided to help user building server backend applications (bot, agents) based on Rainbow S2S API modules to interact with Rainbow server system without directly implementing the underlaying REST protocol and callback notifications mechanism. This starter guide will help you : Understand Rainbow S2S API Setup Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS in a linux server environnement (for other environnements,the tools used here are the same, you will have to refer to installation process for your OS) Subscribe to Rainbow server callback notifications and build your own server application in your chosen language. Prerequisites To use the Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS you need an applicationID and a secretKey from the openrainbow hub. These information allow you to identify your application and allow you to use the Rainbow platform. For more information, see Applications lifecycle which explains what is the purpose, how to create an application and how to get the application ID and the secret key. The hostname is also necessary to know which server is used: the sandbox or the production server. As Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS is intended to be used on a server it is recommended to have a Linux OS with those minimum components installed : NodeJS (see https://nodejs.org/en/download/ for other OS) npm package manager (see https://www.npmjs.com/get-npm for other OS) @openapitools/openapi-generator-cli (node component) (as an npm package the installation is the same for all OS https://openapi-generator.tech/docs/installation/) It is also recommened to have a minimum knowledge on OAS standard (Open API Specification). What are S2S API modules used in Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS Rainbow S2S module are based on REST APIs description over OpenAPI standard (via swagger files [openapi.yaml or openapi.json]) so user can generate client implementations in various languages and hide REST calls by manipulating objects. User can still make direct REST calls to Rainbow S2S platform, and implement callbacks events over webhook (web server that will received POST events messages from Rainbow system) but it's not recommended. Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS uses S2S generated nodejs API from S2S swagger definition and provides chat and presence communication features between server side program and Rainbow system. Rainbow OpenAPI Specifications files (swagger files) Rainbow server exposes various RESTfull enpoints to help users intergrating communication features in their own applications. Those RESTfull API endpoints are described in OAS swagger definition files. OAS specificationsDescription Rainbow Authentication PortalAuthentication API S2S PortalServer to server API. For the moment it is essentially used for Instant messaging communication. Each swagger file can be used to generate client APIs that hide all REST protocol and data consistency check. Rainbow-S2S-StarterKit-NodeJS composition S2S NodeJS StarterKit implements S2S client APIs in NodeJS to interact with Rainbow and a local REST server (to handle webhook events via callback url). Rainbow acts as a client for the REST server (by POSTING events data on a public endpoint defined by the callbak url). Configuration file Configuration fileDescription rainbow-s2s-starterkit-nodejs/config/StarterKitConfig.json.samplestarter kit main configuration file (to rename .json and update according to your Rainbow registration params). It defines bot credentials, localhost server settings. Rainbow-S2S-Starterkit-NodeJS configuration file is used to configure 6 main entities. Configuration file entityDescription rainbowConfigures the Rainbow server host we are connecting to and tells Rainbow who we are credentialscontains registered account credentials applicationcontains the application registration keys appID and appSecret logscontains logs enablement config imenables or disables automatic IM read acknowledgement rainbow_notification_serviceconfigure each component (Rainbow-S2S-Starterkit-NodeJS internal proxy named ngrok or your own reverse proxy and zmq ) involved in webhook event notification [ config.json] { "rainbow": { "host": "sandbox", }, "credentials": { "login": "bot@mycompany.com", // To replace by your developer credendials "password": "xxxxxxx" // To replace by your developer credentials }, // Application identifier "application": { "appID": "", // To repmace with your applicationID "appSecret": "", // To replace with your app secret key }, // Logs options "logs": { "enableConsoleLogs": true, "enableFileLogs": false, "file": { "path": '/var/tmp/rainbowsdk/', "level": 'debug' } }, // IM options "im": { "sendReadReceipt": false }, "rainbow_notification_service": { "description":"Configure Rainbow notificat

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21CompareSDK for Web Here is the list of the changes and features provided by the Rainbow-Web-SDK [4.0.0-LTS] - 2022-11-21 contact model - a
content: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 4.0.0Published on 2022-12-21CompareSDK for Web Here is the list of the changes and features provided by the Rainbow-Web-SDK [4.0.0-LTS] - 2022-11-21 contact model - add new properties related to custom user profile management : fileSharingEnabled, fileStorageEnabled, instantMessagesEnabled, bubblesEnabled, webrtcAudioEnabled, webrtcVideoEnabled, webrtcSharingEnabled, modifyProfileEnabled; contact model - Add also professionalMobileNumber and professionalMobileNumberCan pbxService - Add new APIs: subscribeToCCDEvents and getCurrentCCDAgentStatus for the CCD Agent management [3.4.0-STS] - 2022-10-06 conferenceRecording - add conferenceRecording that allows to record web conferences on server side suggestionsService - add suggestionsService that allows to find contact suggestions in the same company, i.e. "people you may know" BREAKING CHANGE - Message model no longer contains alternativeContent, use additionalContent instead [3.3.0-STS] - 2022-08-25 callsLogService - the maximum number of call logs per request is 250 (both for fetchCallLogs and fetchPaginatedCallLogs) virtualBackground - add virtualBackground Service to manage the virtual background for calls [3.2.0-STS] - 2022-06-14 General bug fixes and stability improvements [3.1.3-STS] - 2022-06-16 Fix HDMI Screens chosen as output device when plugged-in. [3.1.2-STS] - 2022-06-03 Fix dual channel headset issues; Fix STEREO microphone use cases [3.1.1-STS] - 2022-05-18 Fix problems with the audio devices management [3.1.0-STS] - 2022-05-16 WebRTCService - ### BREAKING CHANGE ### remove useSpeaker and useCamera and useMicrophone APIs (user should use the new deviceManagement service) ### BREAKING CHANGE ### remove setChromeExtensionIdForSharing API (and globally deactivate chrome extension for sharing, as no longer needed) deviceManagement - ### BREAKING CHANGE ### Service to be used for the device management (audio input/output and video input devices) [3.0.2-LTS] - 2022-04-27 CallsLogService -- remove deprecated getAll() API [3.0.1-LTS] - 2022-04-22 Fix problems with signout method that sometimes does not resolve the promise [3.0.0-LTS] - 2022-04-21 Support of WebRTC unified plan for all calls and conference Includes all the changes introduced in the STS versions 2+ (see previous changelog entries) [2.13.0-STS] - 2022-04-01 WebRTCService - after removing sharing from a call containing remote video stream, the #large_video element is updated now automatically to the remote video stream webConference - add new Web Conference Service V2 Fix issues with conferencesService [2.12.2-STS] - 2022-03-18 Fix problems with signout() method [2.12.1-STS] contactsService - add new API isCalendarSharingActivated presenceService - add new event RAINBOW_ONMYCONTACTPRESENCECHANGED fired when there's change in the contact presence / status FIX: remote video is added automatically when RAINBOW_ONWEBRTCCALLSTATECHANGED is fired and there are remote streams available [2.12.0-STS] IMPORTANT: deactivated new models by default. Use config or useNewModels API to activate them. Starting this version the old models are recommended for usage ConfigService - add new APIs: setAutoAway and setAutoAwayDelay pbxService - add new event: RAINBOW_ONFORWARDMODEUPDATED pbxService - add new APIs: getForwardMode and setForwardMode callsLogService - fix problems with RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGACKUPDATED event after calling markAllCallsLogsAsRead API conversationsService - fix issues with openConversationForBubble API. It becomes asynchronous now and works with closed conversations. conversationsService - remove @deprecated tag from openConversationForBubble and openConversationForContact [2.11.0-STS] ContactsService - add two new APIs : getUserAutoDndCalendarSetting and updateUserAutoDndCalendarSetting BubblesService - add new API : reactivateInactiveBubble ConnectionService - fix bugs with connection methods. From now on user can not call signin mehtod during another connection process or when the user is already connected. Update TelephonyMode docs PbxService - update docs around the RAINBOW_ONVOICEMESSAGEUPDATED with information about the AVST VoiceMail type ContactsService - fix bug in searchCompanyDirectory API [2.10.1-STS] Fix issues with video calls in Firefox Fix issues with loading the SDK [2.10.0-STS] Bubble / Room model - add new property - isAlertNotificationEnabled. It is true when at least one member of the bubble has the feature enabled. Contact model - add new property - isAlertNotificationEnabled. It is true when the contact has the feature enabled. ChannelsService - signature of createItem changes. url parameter is deleted (no longer used) Add new service - telephonyKeysService allowing user handle speed dial keys TelephonyService - add new methods: getTelephonyMode and setTelephonyMode. They allow the Cloud PBX (Rainbow HUB) user to change telephony mode TelephonyService - remove setNomadicWebRTC after months of deprecation CallsLogService - prevent RAIN

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: PricingChoose the offer that fits your needsThe Rainbow for Developers platform offers a free on-boarding to all developers to start their application development. Create your application for free tod
content: PricingChoose the offer that fits your needsThe Rainbow for Developers platform offers a free on-boarding to all developers to start their application development. Create your application for free today and access to many resources while using our REST APIs or SDKs. (contacts management, chat, voice, video, screen sharing, file transfer, bubbles, bots and much more...)CPaaS Subscription OfferingsNEWAPP CONNECTSubscription via the App Connect offerFor Business PartnersPayment according to the number of App Connect licenses subscribedManageThe App Connect offer is available to all developers with a Business Partner. It offers a predictive business model that will allow you to define a customer sales price without surprises.Register on the Rainbow for Developers portal, create your App Connect application and deploy it when ready.An App Connect application is designed to provide WebRTC communications (Audio, Video, Screen Sharing) and collaboration (chat, screen sharing, file sharing, etc.). Provisioning and administration functions are included in the App Connect subscription.For pricing details, contact our sales representatives.Contact-usBilling will be based on the number of licenses subscribed by the Business Partner for one customer and one App Connect application.PAY AS YOU GOSelf-serviceFor developersDigital paymentManageThe pay-as-you-go offer is accessible to all developers in self-service on the Rainbow for Developers platform.Register on the platform, create your application for free in the sandbox, leave you payment details and push your application to production once ready.Contact our sales representatives in order to start a business discussion on the business model of your project.Contact-usEach measured item is priced specifically. You get a free level of usage on the production platform before we start invoicing every month for the usage your application is making of the Rainbow for Developers platform.Pricing detailsUsage is measured and invoiced on four elements per application [1]Administration APIs(Create, manage objects and identities on the platform)2000 API calls/month free then 0,005€/$ per API call[2] See below for complete list of APIBots & Resources APIs(Use and connect objects to create services)5000 API calls/month free then 0,001€/$ per API call[3] See below for complete list of APIWebRTC minutes(Minutes of voice, video, screenshare used by your identities on the platform)500 min/month free then 0,005€/$ per minStorage(Gigabytes used by your identities),5 GB/month free then 0,1€/$ per GBNotes:[1] When starting and during execution, our SDKs perform additionnal API requests to keep consistent data with Rainbow, that are part and mixed to the monthly measure.[2] Administration element targets the following Rainbow API categories: Administration API, Subscription API, Invoices API, Metrics API. This concerns REST API and SDKs when calling methods for administrating users or companies.[3] Resources element targets the following Rainbow API: Authentication API + All other API offered by SDK for managing resources like bubbles, groups, files, chat, etc..., that are not addressing API listed in [2].Invoice is done on a monthly basis for the usage of the previous month. Credit card payment is automatic once the invoice is issued [1].Notes:[1] Number of APIs consumed per application is updated every hour and consultable on the Rainbow for Developers website.BUSINESS PROJECTSDirect touch / BP SalesTailored pricingConsultative sellingContact-usIn case your application is part of a business project with a customer or as a software vendor, we would be happy to have a business conversation to evaluate the opportunity for a tailored business model approach [1].You can register on the platform today and start your project. Create your application in the sandbox today, and push your application to production once a business model is agreed.Contact our sales representatives in order to start a business discussion on the adapted business model for your project.By tailored business models, we mean that we can propose pricing models that are more predictable in costs than a pay-as-you-go model (price per user, per company, per bot, per interaction or any other metric that may fit your project).Those models allow you and/or your customers to have a better alignement between the metrics that matter to you and your customer, and the Rainbow services and resources consumption of your application.Notes:[1] As an ALE Business Partner, the use of a provisioning application that you have developed is free.Feedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProductsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsUseful linksDocumentationStoreSupportPricingHomeExploreLegal informationsServices AgreementDeveloper AgreementCookie policyThird party softwareCompanyPartnerVisit usRainbowContact usFollow us on
